Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: LOL ... jst ran the filter on blackjok3r3 staked notary on KMD.... took about 30mins to import the private key, 46,000 txs in the wallet ... 3mins at only 10% cpu one core, to run the filter over it.... just hung for an eternity.... But at the end, left it with 170 txs in the wallet. Seems stable, even if slow ... I think that remvoing the LOCK(cs_walelt) from the erase function might speed it up a heap, but it also seems super unsafe... so not going to. Staked chains do use the erasefromwallet function at times, so removing the lock seems dangerous.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: In any casethe first time you run it, you should just send entire balance and run `clearwalletnotarisations <txid>` of the send balance to self... and it will start with a single tx in the wallet, just as if you used hte old reset methods.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Found one possible problem with the cleannwalletnotarisations RPC ... it may require that the wallet is reset to a single utxoo before using it more than once. ... a-team just ended up with a utxo (one that is split) that someehow got left behind after 2 calls of the RPC... I will monitor it, I dont think its an issue if the wallet starts from a single utxo... 

There was some logic I added to stop this from happening, but I can see how it cant work, if there are transacitons more than 3 txs deep saved in the wallet. 
Problem is, is that it deletes the txs that came after this tx, so then the wallet sees this tx as unspent. I didnt add logic to iterate back further than 3 txs deep for preformance reasons, but if starting from 1 utxo then splitting, notarising and running the wallet filter, it will always delete the tx it started with on each run, and should not happen.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just to amke sure, please dont run the filter more than once on staked notaries, until I have workied this out, you will end up unabe to split utxo and you will stop notarising.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I want the notary operators to focus on their real job here, and thats decideing what to notarise, and who deservs bug bounties, if they are spending time on maintenace and keepingthe node in an operational state their time might not be focued where it needs to be.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We dont want a situation, where me and Alright, choose which chains everyone should notarise, and blindly follow our orders, the notaries have the power, not us.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: With a heavliy stake based approach, its in notaries best interst financially to do what is best for the network... Effectivly there can even be multiple notary networks playing off against each other competing for chains to notarise, will be very interesting to see hwo it all pans out.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Although each network of notaries needs a KMD notary node to fund the notarisations to KMD .... otherwise they need to purchase it at mrket value.

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: so, is the idea here a bunch of chains all notarizing to each other?

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: i've been following but i don't quite get the concept of staked

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: i just see a bunch of crazy innovation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no all chains notariise to KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There is one chain called STAKED

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that is 51% PoS 49% PoW

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that chain has currency STAKED coin

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: A person/entity cna create their own chain, with their own smart contracts... and have staked notaries notarise that chain, it *can* and is most cases should, share the currecny STAKED

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So you purchase/mine/stake STAKED then burn some of it to create your own chain in the cluster... You cna choose not to burn any STAKED

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and just create a chain, with 0 supply, then migrate STAKED from anohter chain in the cluster to your chain and do whatever with it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its to allow people to dev/test CC contracts without forcing all other chains in the cluster to have the same contracts

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and without having to create new currency for every contract ... as that is unsustaiable

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: haveing millions of diffrent currenies for each contract seems a bit stupid, when we have the tech to share currency over chains with diffrent consesnus rules.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: tbh we dont even know what STAKED will end up being, our goal is to attract as many devs and smart people as possible, and create thigns people can actually use with KMD tech.
